sections: We really want a Motorious reader to win this Corvette!
1963 marked the first year for the generation that would go on to be referred to as the mid-year
. Despite implications of mediocrity created by this name, the second generation Corvette was anything but. In fact, many enthusiasts believe that 1963 through 1967 model years are among the best for

Thanks to Auburn Cord Duesenberg Automobile Museum in Auburn, Indiana, you can now enter to win a 1963 example packed with all of the features that made the mid-year Corvette so good. This matching numbers

features a 360-horsepower, fuel injected 327-cid small-block V8 paired to a 4-speed manual transmission and a fully independent suspension. Making this icon even more iconic, this example has a white soft top over a well equipped black leather interior.
If you have always wanted to own one of the most beautiful and

of all time, this is your chance and all you have to do is enter to win by making a donation between $25 and $2,500 to the Auburn Cord Duesenberg Automobile Museum. The more you donate the more entries you will get and Motorious Readers get a bonus no matter how much you donate.
Auburn Cord Duesenberg Automobile Museum is a non-profit organization that is dedicated to preserving and sharing Auburn’s rich automotive history. Proceeds from this raffle will go to

continue its goal of providing unique educational experiences based on automotive history, essentially preserving the legacy of the National Historic Landmark building and the automotive collection and archives it holds.
This raffle is set to end on December 27, 2021 so enter now to win. Don’t miss out on this incredible opportunity to get behind the wheel of
one of the most stunning Corvettes
